definitions.definition: have a desire to possess or do (something); wish for.
synonyms: covet; need; informalhave a yen for
be dying for "do you want more coffee?"

definitions.definition: wish to consult or speak to (someone).
examples: Tony wants me in the studio

definitions.definition: (of the police) desire to question or apprehend (a suspected criminal).
examples: he is wanted by the police in connection with an arms theft
I've wanted you since the first moment I saw you

definitions.definition: (of a thing) require to be attended to in a specified way.
ought, should, or need to do something.
examples: you don't want to believe everything you hear
synonyms: must "you want to be more careful"

definitions.definition: desire to be in or out of a particular place or situation.
examples: if anyone wants out, there's the door

definitions.definition: lack or be short of something desirable or essential.
examples: you shall want for nothing while you are with me

definitions.definition: (chiefly used in expressions of time) be short of or lack (a specified amount or thing).
examples: it wanted twenty minutes to midnight
synonyms: be missing "this mollycoddled generation wants for nothing"

definitions.definition: a lack or deficiency of something.
examples: Victorian houses which are in want of repair

definitions.definition: the state of being poor and in need of essentials; poverty.

examples: the expression of our wants and desires
synonyms: requirement; informalyen "all her wants would be taken care of"
